data.quote: A person who wrote badly did better than a person who does not write at all. A bad writing can be corrected. An empty page remains an empty page.
data.author: Israelmore Ayivor

data.quote: Look within. Within is the fountain of good, and it will ever bubble up, if thou wilt ever dig.
data.author: Marcus Aurelius

data.quote: One today is worth two tommorows.
data.author: Benjamin Franklin

data.quote: Every moment and every event of every man's life on earth plants something in his soul.
data.author: Thomas Merton

data.quote: A place for everything, everything in its place.
data.author: Benjamin Franklin

data.quote: Be faithful to that which exists within yourself
data.author: Andre Gide

data.quote: Nurture your minds with great thoughts. To believe in the heroic makes heroes.
data.author: Benjamin Disraeli

data.quote: We have it in our power to begin the world over again.
data.author: Thomas Paine

data.quote: You don't look out there for God, something in the sky, you look in you.
data.author: Alan Watts

data.quote: Give light, and the darkness will disappear of itself.
data.author: Desiderius Erasmus

data.quote: There are glimpses of heaven to us in every act, or thought, or word, that raises us above ourselves.
data.author: Robert Quillen

data.quote: You never know when some small thing will lead to a big idea. Travel is very inspirational - but it's in the ordinary that I find my themes of love and work and family.
data.author: Adriana Trigiani

data.quote: Happiness is the natural flower of duty.
data.author: Phillips Brooks

data.quote: No act of kindness, no matter how small, is ever wasted.
data.author: Aesop

data.quote: As we express our gratitude, we must never forget that the highest appreciation is not to utter words, but to live by them.
data.author: John F. Kennedy

data.quote: Keep your feet on the ground, but let your heart soar as high as it will. Refuse to be average or to surrender to the chill of your spiritual environment.
data.author: Arthur Helps

data.quote: Try to be a rainbow in someone's cloud.
data.author: Maya Angelou

data.quote: The measure of who we are is what we do with what we have.
data.author: Vince Lombardi

data.quote: If I have seen further than others, it is by standing upon the shoulders of giants.
data.author: Isaac Newton

data.quote: Even if I knew that tomorrow the world would go to pieces, I would still plant my apple tree.
data.author: Martin Luther
